summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, signed by R. Alexander Acosta, notifying an identified victim's attorney that their client was on the list of individuals the U.S. was prepared to name as victims of Jeffrey Epstein in a federal indictment. It explains Epstein's state plea deal and the victim's preserved right to file a civil claim under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255, and provides contact information for Epstein's attorney, Jack Goldberger.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty in Palm Beach County to felony solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. He was sentenced to 12 months' imprisonment, followed by 6 months' imprisonment, then 12 months of community control.

events.title: Victim Notification Letter Sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends formal notification to an identified victim's attorney that their client was on the list of individuals the U.S. was prepared to name as victims in a federal indictment against Epstein.

locations: 250 Australian Avenue South, Suite 1400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges (solicitation and procurement of minors for prostitution) on June 30, 2008, receiving an 18-month jail sentence followed by community control.
The U.S. Attorney's Office, led by R. Alexander Acosta, agreed to defer federal prosecution in favor of this state plea deal.
A key condition of the deal was that identified minor victims retained the right to file civil claims under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255 as if Epstein had been federally convicted.
This letter is formal notification to one such identified victim (via their attorney) that they were on the list of individuals the U.S. was prepared to name as victims in a federal indictment.

The letter directs the victim's attorney to contact Epstein's attorney, Jack Goldberger, if a civil claim is filed, and notes that the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI cannot assist in civil litigation.
